newsitem.title: UK: NWE gas oil slightly stronger in thin holiday mark.
newsitem.headline: NWE gas oil slightly stronger in thin holiday mark.

text.p: NWE gas oil traded sideways on Thursday as much of Europe enjoyed public holidays.
May IPE gas oil, which expires on May 12, was at $168.00 at 1200 GMT, up 50 cents while the June contract was down 50 cents at $166.00.
Barge business was muted with heating oil premium levels assessed as unchanged around May IPE +$1.
Cargo premiums were also steady with DIN looking to attact buyers around June IPE +$5-5.50. FOD remains notionally 50 cents or so weaker with interest sparse even before the today's holiday.
Diesel premiums have eased a touch with barrels talked around June IPE +$12 cif NWE.
